results.title: How to grow roses
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau and John Ott Pictures
results.brief_description: Outlines the rose’s origin, geographic distribution, and varying habits, form and character. Shows many of the 90 genera comprising the rose family. Includes practical hints on cultivation, general care and pruning.

results.title: The Human skeleton. Part 3. Muscles, movements and pressure
results.creator_credit: Beryl Denman Lacey, Frank Wells and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Shows the workings of muscles and tendons within the human skeletal structure, with main emphasis on the diaphragm and the muscles required to maintain a human in an erect position.

results.title: How to conduct a work sampling study
results.brief_description: This film offers a convenient and practical “tool” for teaching supervisors and managers how to conduct their own studies. It demonstrates the role of work measurement in reducing costs and the step-by-step procedures in planning, preparing, performing and reporting.

results.title: How to catch a cold
results.brief_description: This film shows how colds are spread, how a day or so in bed protects the whole community, and how a cold may be the first symptoms of more serious illness.

results.title: How to build an igloo
results.creator_credit: Douglas Wilkinson, Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A demonstration of igloo-building in Canada’s far North, showing how the site is selected and how blocks of snow are used to make a snug shelter against the Arctic cold. Two Eskimos staying overnight at a trading post construct an igloo in only an hour and a half. As the camera follows each stage in the process, the commentary explains why the snow must be so carefully chosen, why the blocks are built up in a spiral, and how the completed igloo is ventilated. Editing, Neil Harris. Script, Doug Wilkinson. Cinematography, Chester C. Kissick.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Douglas Wilkinson, Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.description: A demonstration of igloo-building in Canada’s far North, showing how the site is selected and how blocks of snow are used to make a snug shelter against the Arctic cold. Editing, Neil Harris. Script, Doug Wilkinson. Cinematography, Chester C. Kissick.
